page.title: 12AMORES (HISTORIC HOUSE) I
page.content: The house is a timber framed house built in 1485.It is built with a timber structure and has white plaster on the outside.The Seckers (previous owners)have put a layer of stucco over the plaster.The timber frame is very secure.Every time a beam falls out of place the house gives a big squeal.A speacilist visited the house and said that 90 % of the beams could fall out of place and the house would still stand.So far 30% of the beams have fallen out of the place.Amores got it's name from a John Amores.It was built of oak timbers slotted together. Some of the windows are georgian and some victorian.Elizabeth Armstone once lived in Amores,she scratched her name on one of the windows.Mrs.Seckers house is a tudor house and is nearly five hundred years old.Round the back there is an air raid shelther.]]]]]]
